alert.note: Alert for Lumpkin; Towns; Union; White (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 12:52PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...AN AREA OF SNOW WILL AFFECT TOWNS...NORTHEASTERN LUMPKIN... NORTHERN WHITE AND CENTRAL UNION COUNTIES... At 1249 PM EST, snow was located in higher elevations of far northeast Georgia, along and south of a line from Gumlog to Tate City. Movement was south at 15 mph. Locations impacted include... Hiawassee, Blairsville, Young Harris, Helen, Unicoi State Park, Suches, Robertstown, Blue Mountain Shelter, Gumlog, Titus, Woods Hole Shelter, Low Gap Shelter, Vogel State Park, Anna Ruby Falls, Plum Orchard Gap Shelter, Sautee, Whitley Gap Shelter, Brasstown Bald, Mountain Scene and Owltown. Impacts from this area of heavy snow will be confined to elevations above approximately 2500 feet. The snow can accumulate at a rate of one-half inch inch per hour or more in this area of snow. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions. Consider delaying travel if you will be going through this area of snow. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
